title: Atelectasis
summary: Atelectasis is the collapse or closure of a lung resulting in reduced or absent gas exchange.  It is usually unilateral, affecting part or all of one lung.[2] It is a condition where the alveoli are deflated down to little or no volume, as distinct from pulmonary consolidation, in which they are filled with liquid. It is often called a collapsed lung, although that term may also refer to pneumothorax.[1]
